ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Wirral - Page
ai_page.body:
Making changes to your home if you are a disabled person

If you are a disabled person or elderly, making changes to your home can help you to move around it more easily.

Disabled Facility Grant

You can apply for a grant called the Disabled Facility Grant (DFG) which can be used to pay for facilities for your home. You can apply for the grant whether you rent or own your home.

Wirral Council manages applications and decides on the most appropriate scheme for you and your home. These changes are funded completely or partially by the grant and the amount of funding you receive will be based on your income.

The adaptation scheme can help you with changes including:

  • widening doors or installing ramps
  • providing a level-access shower
  • providing vertical lifts or stair lifts
  • providing washing, bathing or toilet facilities on the ground floor
  • providing access to a garden

The council will ensure that the changes are suitable for your needs, and this is done with the help of an occupational therapist (OT).

If you require changes to your home

If you need changes to your home you can complete an assessment form below to tell us about your needs. You can use the form to tell us about any benefits you receive. This will help us to decide if you are eligible for any financial assistance.

Further information

Please read below the Interim Housing Adaptations Assistance Statement 2022, which should also be read with the Private Sector Housing and Regeneration Assistance Policy.

The PDF files below may not be suitable to view for people with disabilities, users of assistive technology or mobile phone devices.

  • Interim Adaptions Assistance Statement 2022 (PDF, 434KB)
  • Private Sector Housing and Regeneration Assistance Policy (PDF, 391KB)

Apply

If you receive benefits you will need to send a digital copy of your benefits letter with the form.

Apply to make changes to your home

Contact us

We are currently only receiving applications via the online form above until further notice. To request a telephone consultation, please use the email address below.

For adult cases only

To request a telephone consultation:

email homeadaptationsteam@wirral.gov.uk

For child cases

Please liaise with your child’s registered occupational therapist with regards to a referral being made into the service by them, as they are specialists in classification for child cases. If your child does not already have a registered occupational therapist allocated then please seek a GP or paediatrician referral for access to an occupational therapist via a medical referral.

Updates will continue to be provided by case officers, however should you need to contact us please email homeadaptationsteam@wirral.gov.uk.

We will be regularly accessing any messages left on the 0151 691 8090 number and will respond as soon as we can. We apologise for any inconvenience caused.

ai_business_case.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Wirral - Business Case
ai_business_case.letter:
To the CEO,

Subject: Recommendations for Enhancing the Council's Online Service for Flat Modification Requests

Overview:
The recent review of the customer persona, feedback, and existing page content indicates a primarily positive customer experience with some targeted areas for improvement. Notably, the customer profile of David—a council tenant comfortable with online processes—suggests that clarity and ease of navigation are key to maintaining and enhancing user satisfaction while reducing administrative overhead.

Feedback Summary:
- The feedback confirms that the current information effectively explains the process, which is a strong foundation.
- However, the respondent highlights that the instructions could be clearer regarding how to initiate the application online and what steps to follow.

Key Issues and Suggested Improvements:
1. **Clarity in the Call-to-Action (CTA):** The current information mentions completing the "assessment form" but does not explicitly guide users on how to start their application directly.
   
2. **Streamlined Navigation & Instructions:** Incorporating explicit, step-by-step guidance and prominent links/buttons could reduce confusion. 

3. **Multiple Contact Methods:** Clearly separating online and alternative contact options, such as email or phone, with clear instructions, will reassure users that support is accessible.

Potential Progress and Impact:
- **Step-by-step Guidance:** Embedding a simple, numbered instruction set at the top of the page or near the application form will make it instantly clear where to start, what information is needed, and how to proceed. For example, “Step 1: Complete the online assessment form. Step 2: Upload photos or plans. Step 3: Wait for confirmation.”

- **Direct Links to Application Forms:** Ensuring that the online form is prominently linked and easily identifiable will reduce user frustration and decrease the likelihood of drop-offs.

- **Clear Alternative Contact Options:** Explicitly listing all options for assistance with direct contact details, with reassurance of prompt responses, will alleviate concerns about delays.

- **Impact on Customer Experience and Efficiency:**
  - **Customer Satisfaction:** Clear instructions will decrease anxiety and increase confidence in the process.
  - **Service Efficiency:** Fewer support queries and misunderstandings mean less time spent clarifying processes, allowing staff to focus on processing applications.
  - **Cost Savings:** Streamlining the process reduces administrative overhead and minimizes missed or incomplete applications, ultimately saving council resources.

In conclusion, implementing these specific improvements—particularly a straightforward, step-by-step online guidance and prominent direct links—will make the system more intuitive for users like David. This will enhance the customer experience while achieving operational efficiencies, aligning with our strategic goals of service excellence and cost management.

Respectfully,

[Your Name]
Web Usability Lead
